meanings.definition: A printed report containing news of interest to a particular group.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy reading the newsletters from our local community center.
meanings.sent2: Every month, I receive a newsletter from the library with upcoming events.
meanings.sent3: The cat insisted on sitting on the newsletters, claiming they were the comfiest spot.
meanings.sent4: The newsletters were like a treasure trove of information, waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The colorful newsletters caught my eye, drawing me in with their enticing headlines.

meanings.definition: A bulletin issued periodically to the members of a society or other organization.
meanings.sent1: The church sends out newsletters to keep the congregation informed.
meanings.sent2: The school's newsletters always include updates on upcoming events.
meanings.sent3: The newsletters were so popular, they had their own fan club.
meanings.sent4: Receiving the newsletters felt like being part of an exclusive club.
meanings.sent5: The newsletters acted as a bridge, connecting members of the organization.

meanings.definition: A publication containing news and information for a specific audience.
meanings.sent1: The company's newsletters provide employees with important updates.
meanings.sent2: I look forward to the newsletters from my favorite magazine each month.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to read the newsletters, thinking they were filled with catnip recipes.
meanings.sent4: In a world of chaos, the newsletters were a beacon of reliable information.
meanings.sent5: The newsletters served as a lifeline, keeping readers connected and informed.
